text: Paul Denny (born 24 July 1972) is an Australian stage, television and film actor who played the lead in the international production of Johnno from the novel by David Malouf. ==Filmography== {| class="wikitable" |- ! Year || Title || Role || Director |- | 2008 || Rats and Cats || Bruce || Tony Rogers |- | 2003 || Under the Radar || Eric || Evan Clarry |- | 2000 || Hildegarde || Constable Peters || Di Drew |- | 1996 || Joey || Davo || Ian Barry |} ==Television== {| class="wikitable" |- ! Year || Title || Role || Other notes |- | 2004 || Blue Heelers || Peter Matarazzo || Directed by Chris Langman for the Seven Network |- | 2010 || Lowdown || Bob Geraghty || Directed by Amanda Brotchie |- | 2010–2011 || "Offspring (TV series)" || Sam Jenkins || |- | 2013 || Neighbours || Brian O'Loughlin || |- | 2017 || Sexy Herpes || Dean || 1 episode |- | 2019 || My Life Is Murder || Dan || 1 episode |} ==Theatre== {| class="wikitable" |- ! Year || Title || Role || Other notes |- | 2006 || Johnno || Johnno || Directed by Stephen Edwards (La Boite Theatre / Derby Playhouse) |- |} ==Awards and nominations== ===Stage awards=== *1997 – Won – Matilda Award for Scar *2002 – Won – The Glugs of Gosh Award for Excellence in Theatre *2003 – Won – Matilda Award for The Removalists and A Day in the Death of Joe Egg *2004 – Won – Best Actor – Kaleidoscope Short Film Festival for Top Blokes ==References== ==External links== *Official website * Category:1972 births Category:Australian male television actors Category:Australian male film actors Category:Australian male stage actors Category:Living people Category:Male actors from Brisbane
title: Paul Denny
